definition: to leak/to flow/to catch on fire
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Slice through the water, don't plow. Make your middle name "streamline".
sentences.chinese: 走水无需劈波斩浪，要呈“流线型”。

sentences.english: After all, man struggles upwards; water flows downwards.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，人往高处走水往低处流。

definition: sports such as soccer, basketball and volleyball that use large balls/see also 小球[xiao3 qiu2]
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
Yuchi or Yuchih township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
to report a case to the authorities (old)
landslide/avalanche/to take a walk in the mountains
to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
